meanings.definition: Capable of being demanded or required
meanings.sent1: The payment was exactable by law.
meanings.sent2: The exactable amount was clearly stated in the contract.
meanings.sent3: The exactable fee for the service made everyone gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her exactable determination to succeed was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of not meeting the exactable deadline were severe.

meanings.definition: Able to be extracted or obtained
meanings.sent1: The information was exactable from the database.
meanings.sent2: The exactable data was crucial for the research project.
meanings.sent3: He found the exactable solution hidden in the report.
meanings.sent4: Her exactable talent for finding bargains saved them money.
meanings.sent5: The exactable truth finally came to light after years of searching.
